snippet: The tenor Won Whi Choi morphed from boorish to brooding in his portrayal of the title character in “The Tales of Hoffman” in a Prelude to Performance program at the Kaye Playhouse.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews production of Offenbach opera Tales of Hoffmann, directed by E Loren Meeker and starring tenor Won Whi Choi at Hunter College's Kay Playhouse, as part of Martina Arroyo Foundation's Prelude to Performance program.
lead_paragraph: The tenor Won Whi Choi morphed from boorish to brooding in his portrayal of the title character in “The Tales of Hoffman” in a Prelude to Performance program at the Kaye Playhouse.

headline.seo: ‘Tales of Hoffmann,’ Showcases Young Voices at Kaye Playhouse
headline.main: A Way With Words, but No Lasting Luck With the Ladies
headline.print_headline: A Way With Words, but No Lasting Luck With the Ladies
